resp.text: We apologize that we didn't meet your expectations. We have thousands of different products and we try to only carry the best products available, but even the best products sometimes have issues. name: Christi Peterson
text:
I am the owner of Ray's Restaurant. I would like to say that our delivery driver, Jamie is the best! And for him I give him 5 stars. He always makes sure that we have what we need and goes above and beyond to make sure that we get it. Thanks Jamie!

The reason that I am giving Uni1st an overall 3  stars is because we often have problems withour towels being full of lint. They also come torn or very worn also. We sometimes do not get a full bag, shorting us before our next delivery.  Our aprons that we receive often have half of the tie torn off. So we can't even tie them on. Also, they come very stained occasionally as if they have been mildewed and then laundered. The mildew stain is still there after the wash. We pay a fee each week for these items to be replaced as needed, but we rarely see new items in the
mix. We have also had problems with the posting of payments in a timely manner. Because the payments are not posted we then get a late charge added to the bill. It would be great if these small issues could get taken care of.

text: Great store with great management. Ask for Minnie for all your uniform needs. She will go over and beyond to make sure you're taken care of.

name: Carol Roberts
text:
We have had reasonably good experiences with this store. The prices are quite high but the selection of styles and sizes in Montgomery is second to none. They will also assist you in determining what your school uniform is. They have plenty of dressing rooms to try on clothes and the staff is helpful and patient. We were able to get shirts embroidered the same day and it was free with the purchase of the shirt.

That said, we went far before school started to get this done. If you wait until the week before school it will be a madhouse. We had to go to find an extra shirt for my daughter the first week of school and they actually had a sign where you walk in telling you to stay there until someone came to help you. We ignored it, went straight to the rack to get the shirt, paid and left.

name: jaime toro
text:
I have had a horrible experience with this company and I’m not one to ever write a bad review unless I really feel like I was done wrong. I work for a nursing home and was pregnant and had to buy new scrub tops and they only had one in stock and had to order another one. So they were both already paid for and I ended up not going back to pick it up right away I went back after I had my baby which was only a few months later that I came back to pick my shirt up that I have paid for already. I was told that I couldn’t get my shirt bc it had already been so long since I bought it and that I also couldn’t get my money back and I was never told ever that I had to pick it up by a certain time or I wouldn’t be able to get it and would lose out on a 34 dollar scrub shirt. I was told well it’s on your  receipt. I’m sorry but not very many people read the small fine print on their receipt so if y’all are going to make such a rule that someone can’t get what they paid for if u don’t pick it up within a certain time it would be nice for that to be told to us before we purchase it. So we can be sure to send someone to pick it up if we can’t make it there. I just think it’s absolutely ridiculous that I am now out 32 dollars for something I had no clue about. So they told me they put my shirt back in inventory which means they resold my shirt and just got double the one for that one shirt. I also called to ask for a manager which they were suppose to have call me and it’s now been over a week and I have yet to hear from a manager.

***UPDATE I never said exactly how many months it had been bc I didn’t know exactly how long it had been but what I don’t understand is that I never was told them I only received a text stating that it was at the store a few times never said I had to pick it up by a certain date and I have a different number now so that may could have been a reason why I may not have gotten anything saying I had to pick it up by a certain time I didn’t think it really matter or would hurt for it to sit there considering it was paid for already but it’s fine it’s a loss Its no big deal I just felt like If y’all send stuff back and are gonna do that u should tell everyone before it is every purchased. And I never spoke to a manager or was never told it was a manager I called back the next day after I went to try and pick it up and was told I’d have someone in contact with me about it and never heard back from anyone. I never said I didn’t get a 20 percent discount that isn’t the point I still paid what I’m required to pay so that discount shouldn’t matter in this situation. But it’s fine I honestly don’t want the shirt anymore i just felt it wasn’t handle professionally and should have been told to me before I ever bought the shirt then I would have been sure to have my mom or husband go get the shirt. I’m sorry I didn’t know one shirt would take up that much room.

resp.text:
I’m the owner and this doesn’t sound right at all.  Let me check into this please.

Hi, I checked into this and found out that you ordered this top in January, 7 months ago and our records indicate several phone calls, text messages and emails to you with no response.  Our last attempt to contact you was at the end of May, 5 months after you ordered and stating we’d hold it another 2 weeks but if you didn’t pickup, it would be sent back to the vendor.  When we send a garment back to the vendor and only because we don’t carry that item in the store and don’t have room; we are charged a 20% restocking fee plus UPS & Fed Ex want pickup for less than $12.  So, restocking fee, shipping charges and employee time spent on your purchase does not equal a double profit but rather a loss.  Plus, you payroll deducted and got a 20% discount.  We work very hard to please our customers.  I also talked to the manager and she spoke with you in person on Saturday.  I personally check my receipt for store return policies before going and specially would look if it had been 7 months.

resp.text: Our apologies and thanks for bringing this to our attention. UniFirst has built its positive reputation by delivering excellence in customer service, and it appears one of our Locations may have fallen short of our expectations. Please call our centralized customer service team at (800) 794-2706, so we can open an official Service Request. This closed-loop, computerized system features an automated tracking and resolution process, so issues never fall through the cracks. We record all concerns for follow up within 24 hours, assign clear accountability for actions, maintain a history of requests and actions taken, and close the request only after your satisfaction is confirmed. We appreciate your business and never take it for granted. Thanks for your patience while we work to fix this.

name: Lakisha Stover
text: Update: went back today and same story basically! Conversation with store owner mother Me:Hi I’m here to see if my shoes are in. Mother: gets up and proceed to the register then ask my name! Me: well apparently they’re not here but I have been in here like seven times and ordered Feb. 6th. Now, how fair is that to me? I have looked at reviews and these excuses seem to be the norm! Now I’m not trying to be rude but this is ridiculous. Mother: well we have had some trouble over the last year for some reason getting the merchandise in. Seems demand is more than “they” can supply. Me: well it would be fair to inform the customer so we can decide if we want to wait until whenever or not order. Mother: do u have your receipt? I can look it up quicker. Me: sure let me go to my car and get it. Mother: looks it up oh, are those Cherokee? Me: I don’t know it’s been so long. I have no idea! Mother: we have had a lot of trouble getting that particular brand. Then proceed to the back to speak with Tammy. Comes back well she’s on the phone but says she can give you a call when she gets off. Me: I’m sure she won’t but I will be contacting the BBB because this is wrong on so many levels. I won’t just let it go. Have a good day. No response... sure enough Tammy didn’t call!! Actually order placed 1/24/19! Don’t order anything here it’s a fraud!

This is ridiculous. I will go back Friday to see if my uniforms are ready if not I will be at the Police Department

name: Brittany Hathcote
text: This is one of the sorriest business I have ever had to associate myself with. It took me getting in touch with the BBB and them launching an investigation before I finally received a call that my merchandise was in. I would warn anyone DO NOT have this store place an order for you. If you wanna go in and manage to find something off the rack, fine. It took me 4 months, calling the seller, and contacting the BBB in order to simply receive 3 skirts. I contacted the seller after being told that they were on back order  and was told that those scrubs had not been on back order in months. Seems like the order just wasn't placed. Be VERY careful with these people, because they will NOT give a refund for their inadequacies to run a business.

text: I don’t know how the service was two years ago but the reviews about ordering and never getting the item is TRUE! name: Igor B
text:
The owner was rude, and did not make any effort to help achieve a resolution. A scrub top was purchased here, right before closing time, so my wife couldn't even try it on. After seeing that it does not fit well, it was brought back to the retailer the next business day. The lady then made every excuse not to take back the return, suggesting it has been washed and ironed, and had spots on it, when in fact it hadn't been washed or ironed.  I assured the retailer that we can even show her our work schedule to prove it hasn't been worn to work.  This retailer sold us a defective product and then claimed it's the customers fault that it is defective. After looking at two other scrub tops and finding spots on them, the retailer claimed that they were not there a minute ago and practically implied that one of us is responsible for her manufacturer defect. Buyer beware.

UPDATE: Dear Barb n Bae, thank you for further demonstrating the level of unproffesionalism at your place of business by assuming that Google reviews works like Facebook, and publicly insulting a customer. Clearly, this business is not aware of the terms of policy on Google Reviews. The owner's ( now removed) comment is a blatant conflict-of-interest violation, ( spouse status as LLC co-owner), as well as inappropriate. The time to resolve any misunderstanding was presented, and has came & gone, during the two very civil consecutive visits to the store. If the retailer would like their defective garment for forensic examination and reassurance that it has not been washed or bleached, they are welcome to it.

7/28/2016 Dear William, thank you for your prompt response. We have already offered the garment to you for forensic examination that it has not been washed or bleached. My wife posted a review in addition to mine, as she is a separate individual, and we both had an experience in your store. This purchase was actually our second purchase at your store. We are both educated people, and don't appreciate being taken for fools or called liars. In all reasonable sense, and before calling a returning customer a flat-out liar, you must consider the possibility that some garments you receive from the manufacturer may have had a small defect when you receive them. You may have vast experience in this business, but everyone can make mistakes, and after turning over hundreds of different tops, there is a small chance that something may have been overlooked. Human error occurs, and this is a fact. We are not implying that your M.O. is to rip customers off, however, please understand that when we know for a fact that the garment has not been washed or bleached (why would we do this to a brand new scrub?) , yet we are being told that we washed/bleached it, it creates a sense of mistrust. Had this been TJ Maxx or Target, they would not bother to argue with a returning customer. If you review your video footage, you can see that neither my wife, nor I, was not in any way hostile, did not insult you, and did not raise our voice. Thanks for following up, and God Bless you, as well

text: I wish there was a half a star rating. Our police department used state grant money to buy $600 worth of equipment. Two more months went by and we call, only to be told they are not sure what's going on with the order. Later that week, we called and were told they had to order the equipment from a different vendor. Now 14 months later, we cannot get anyone to answer to get our money back. Worthless crooks and I would not advise anyone doing business here.

name: tim deen
text: On 4/6/17 I ordered three uniform shirts and was told they would be in in two weeks. After two weeks I call back and was told they were on back order. This went on every week until on 5/19/17, I was told they were in and were on the seamstress' table to have stripes and patches sewn on first thing Monday morning. I arrive Monday afternoon to pick up my shirts, only to be told that they would not be in until the next day. I get a little hot and just told the cashier to refund my money and I'll order from Amazon. When I asked to talk to the manager, the cashier informs me that he was the person who just ran to the back of the store. NO CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!! I understand that items will be back ordered, but it is an entirely different issue to be lied to and to waste your gas to find out that the management lied to you. I will never set foot in this place again and I will notify my department and every other officer that I know, what a poor quality business that this is. Ordered from Amazon and they will be in on 5/26/17. Should have started there first.

resp.text: We certainly regret the miscommunication that occurred yesterday while Mr Deen was here. As he states he was informed late last week that his shirts were here and waiting for our seamstress to apply the patches he had provided. That was indeed the case, but when she came to these shirts, there was some confusion as to which patches were to be applied. As a result, the shirts were not complete when the customer arrived. I have personally spoken with this customer and explained that there was a misunderstanding that resulted in his impression that the shirts were not here and that he had been misled. My offer to him was and is to do whatever I can to make this up to him, including immediately applying these patches at no cost to the shirts he is purchasing online. Understandably, he is quite upset, but my offer will stand and I sincerely hope that given time, he will allow me to rectify this issue and regain his trust as a customer.

name: mario vantez
text: Not a single pharmacist or employee wearing a mask. Please respect the safety of your customers in the future.

resp.text: While I do respect your ability to have an opinion on the wearing of masks, context certainly does get lost when our intent is to lecture someone instead of attempting to solve a problem no matter if it is real or perceived.  We strive to make ALL patients and employees comfortable but we also respect their personal decisions.  I do not feel as though immediately taking comments to the internet instead of addressing your concerns in a personal manner is necessary nor is this the appropriate forum for the airing of grievances.  You, Sir, have a wonderful day!  John N. Holley

text: This store has plenty of options ranging from like $12 items and up. They also have so many options when it comes to sizing. Luckily here they have sizes like XSmall, XXSmall, and for the pants they have XSmall Petite and XXSmall Petite. I needed a cheap set to wear for my new job until they could get me the company provided ones ordered, and I found this place yesterday evening and was able to make it there and find some that fit perfect for the new job I start today!

text: My experience was okay. I only had a problem with finding uniform pants to fit my daughter who is 11 years old and wears plus size pants. Every pair that I bought would have to be altered for her height. Which is an inconvenience, due to the fact that school starts for her this week. I wanted to purchase her pants with this company because the quality is so good. Unfortunately, I will have to search other stores, which so far I've had no luck. I also found out by   a store rep that the company will no longer carry girls 16 half size or size 18 in pants. That was very unfortunate to hear. I will have to shop other stores to find her size again.

resp.text:
Good evening, LaTwan,

I appreciate you taking the time to write to us. We have a solution to this situation and I will be happy to help. Please reach out to me with the best number and time to call  you tomorrow. I can be reached at ejb@dennisuniform.com. We'll make sure that your daughter is ready for her first day! Thank you, Elizabeth

text: Fast, friendly service. They are always helpful. Only place I use for my equipment.

name: J Cole
text: This family owned business is a great place to get the right uniform items thats you need. They are knowledgeable about their products and they have a seamstress on staff to help with your embroidery, putting on patches, or hemming up your pants. This is a place I will continue to shop for all my gear for work.

name: Daryl Wright
text: Locally owned business that I will continue to do business with, I bought a pair of boots and a belt there yesterday, the prices are decent plus Jeremy and his wife are very knowledgeable about all of the products they sell.

name: Carly Glover
text: Love emergency wear! They have everything you need down to pins for your shirts. Me and my husband frequently visit just to stop by and talk and see how everyone is and see who is there in the store shopping, because honestly you are bound to run into someone you know. It's the go to place if you need anything to do with law enforcement, first responders, ems, you name it. Shirts, pants, socks shoes. Belts. Hats. They even got silicone wedding bands! I love Jeremy & his crew! They are such sweet people!

name: Jeremy Wise
text: Great folks. Have what I needed and does embroidery on site.

text: Love this place! Great variety of brand scrubs! If they don't have the size or enough of what you want they will get it shipped to you quick! Very helpful staff! Good discounts with employers on scrubs! I get all of my scrubs from this place!

text: These people were so helpful. Took time to answer my questions, as this was my 1st time getting scrubs on my own and not having a place tell me which ones i had to wear. Ordered an extra pair of scrubs and called me when they were ready.

text: Staff was very helpful and nice.  Improved service since my last visit.  This is where my company has contract for white coats.  Better selection and fit this time.

name: Stephanie Therrell
text: Awesome service and really good clearance sales. I called ahead for a specific size and color and they made sure it was in stock and I walked in ten minutes later and my requested items were ready for me. In and out in ten minutes due to exceptional employees who care about their customers. Will definitely recommend and return!!

name: becky peck
text: I was so impressed with the service I received today everyone had a smile and was so helpful they treated me as if my problem was their problem special shout out to Octavia for that beautiful smile however everyone was helpful and kind

name: Sarah Holder
text: I am so overwhelmed by my experience here today. The ladies working were so helpful and went above and beyond to help me find the specific lab coat I needed. I’m not usually one to review places, but I was so impressed by their helpfulness that I had to review.

name: Olivia Kidd
text: Service was absolutely great! Donna was a great help, as well as the owner Lynn. This will always be my go to uniform place. Everyone is friendly and they have a great variety of colors and brands to choose from.

name: Jessie Sluder
text: Love this place! The staff is always so helpful, they always have a huge variety of things to choose from and they're always selling the newest styles and brands!! I won't shop anywhere else for my scrubs!!

name: Matthew Gray
text: This place has a good selection of scrubs compared to the usual uniform store. The staff that was on duty was ridiculously rude and unprofessional in my opinion (ignoring customers until approached, all 4 on duty sitting behind the desk and gossiping, and telling the fed-ex driver who was looking for a new job has to cheat on a drug test).  I will say this, if you need anything out the back (and more than likely you will) that is about the only time they are helpful.

name: Kennedy Edwards
text: Extremely friendly staff that were willing to help and direct purchasing decisions. Even called to verify my preference was available for order before finishing the transaction.
